IRS990.MissionDesc: OPERATIONS & MAINTENANCE OF A PRIVATE HIGH SCHOOL. APPROXIMATELY 280 STUDENTS ENROLLED.
IRS990.Desc: OPERATIONS & MAINTENANCE OF A PRIVATE HIGH SCHOOL. APPROXIMATELY 280 STUDENTS ENROLLED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GIFTS TO THE ENDOWMENT ARE AN INVESTMENT IN THE LONG-TERM FINANCIAL HEALTH OF THE INSTITUTION. INCOME FROM EACH OF THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWED FUNDS IS USED TO FUND THE SCHOOL'S PROGRAM IN PERPETUITY. THE PRINCIPAL IS INVESTED FOR LONG-TERM GROWTH TO SERVE PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS OF STUDENTS. THE ENDOWMENT CURRENTLY PROVIDES NEARLY 29% OF THE SCHOOL'S OPERATING BUDGET.

THE SCHOOL IS A CALIFORNIA NONPROFIT CORPORATION, WHICH IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION NUMBER 501(C)(3) AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA REVENUE AND TAXATION CODE SECTION 23701(D); THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REQUIRED. THE SCHOOL QUALIFIES FOR THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION DEDUCTION UNDER SECTION 170(B)(1)(A) AND IS NOT CONSIDERED TO BE A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE SCHOOL EVALUATES UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WHEREBY THE EFFECT OF THE UNCERTAINTY WOULD BE RECORDED IF THE OUTCOME WAS CONSIDERED PROBABLE AND REASONABLE ESTIMABLE. AS OF JUNE 30, 2016, THE SCHOOL HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING ACCRUAL. THE SCHOOL FILES TAX RETURNS IN CALIFORNIA AND U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTIONS. THE SCHOOL IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS ENDED BEFORE JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011, RESPECTIVELY.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE TRUSTS

CATE SCHOOL ADMITS STUDENTS OF ANY RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORGIN TO ALL RIGHTS, PRIVILEGES, PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES GENERALLY ACCORDED OR MADE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS AT THE SCHOOL. IT DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORGIN IN ADMINISTRATION OF ITS EDUCATIONAL POLICIES, SCHOLARSHIP, ATHLETIC AND OTHER SCHOOL-ADMINISTERED PROGRAMS.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: ADMISSIONS TRIP TO MEET WITH PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS AND PARENTS REGARDING POSSIBLE ATTENDANCE AT SCHOOL THROUGH HOSTING A CONFERENCE.

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.DescriptionOfNonCashAsstTxt: FINANCIAL AID FOR TUITION IN ORDER FOR STUDENT TO ATTEND SCHOOL.
FINANCIAL AID FOR TUITION IN ORDER FOR STUDENT TO ATTEND SCHOOL.
FINANCIAL AID FOR TUITION IN ORDER FOR STUDENT TO ATTEND SCHOOL.
FINANCIAL AID FOR TUITION IN ORDER FOR STUDENT TO ATTEND SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE TO FOREIGN INDIVIDUALS IS USED TO HELP FOREIGN STUDENTS ATTEND THE SCHOOL, WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE UNITED STATES.

EXPENDITURES ARE AUTHORIZED AND ACCOUNTED FOR BY THE UNITED STATES BASED SCHOOL IN ORDER TO SEND SEVERAL STAFF ON A COMBINATION ADMISSIONS/FUNDRAISING TRIP TO SEVERAL ASIAN COUNTRIES TO MEET WITH PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS AND DONORS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS
GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR SELECTED STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF EITHER SCHOLARSHIPS OR FINANCIAL AID AND IS USED FOR TUITION FOR SELECTED STUDENTS IN ORDER FOR THEM TO ATTEND THE SCHOOL.
ORGANIZATION PROVIDES HOUSING FOR HEADMASTER,AND ASSISTANT HEADMASTER AS ORGANZIATION IS A BOARDING SCHOOL WITH STUDENTS LIVING ON CAMPUS.

THE SCHOOL ADOPTED A 457(B) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN FOR A SELECT GROUP OF MANAGEMENT AND HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES. THE PLAN CURRENTLY COVERS ONE EMPLOYEE, BENJAMIN D. WILLIAMS, HEADMASTER. THE TOTAL CONTRIBUTED TO THE PLAN DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2016 WAS $12,772.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 REVIEWED BY BUSINESS MANAGER SANDI PIERCE AND THEN PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, DURING A TRUSTEE MEETING, BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS WILL BE INVESTIGATED AND RESOLVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL COMPENSATION FOR EMPLOYEES INCLUDING THE HEADMASTER, ASSISTANT HEADMASTER, AND BUSINESS MANAGER IS FIRST REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE AND THEN PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. ALSO, COMPENSATION AMOUNTS ARE COMPARED TO DATA OF OTHER COMPARABLE PRIVATE SCHOOLS MAINTAINED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOOL WILL PROVIDE COPIES OF ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE TRUSTS 37.
THE SCHOOL HAS ESTABLISHED AN AUDIT COMMITTEE TO OVERSEE THE ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT.
